title: Match layers to their main function
text:
Think about the scope of each layer:

Application Layer – concerned with network applications and what users interact with. Handles protocols like HTTP, FTP, and DNS.

Transport Layer – responsible for process-to-process communication, ensuring reliable or best-effort data transfer between programs on different hosts (e.g., TCP, UDP).

Network Layer – delivers packets/datagrams from a source host to a destination host across multiple networks (e.g., IP).

Link Layer – transfers data between neighboring devices over a single network link.

Physical Layer – moves bits into and out of the physical transmission medium (e.g., electrical, optical, or radio signals).
